definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
lit. although dead, as if still alive (idiom); still with us in spirit
lit. although dead, also honored; died a glorious death
although small, a steelyard weight may tip a hundred pounds (idiom)/apparently insignificant details can have a large impact/for want of a nail the battle was lost
pinyin: cheng4 tuo2 sui1 xiao3 ya1 qian1 jin1

definition: Although the peony is beautiful, it depends entirely on help from the green leaves (idiom). However brilliant you may be, you can't do anything without support from others.
pinyin: mu3 dan5 sui1 hao3 , quan2 zhang4 lu:4 ye4 fu2

sentences.english: Why she’s a spicy dish: Shilpa has the best of intentions but trouble always seems to find her.
sentences.chinese: 希尔帕虽是一片好心，但麻烦总是找上她。

sentences.english: Despite their many differences, there is a remarkable degree of homogeneity among them.
sentences.chinese: 他们的差异点虽多，但其间亦有极大的同质点。

sentences.english: Middle-aged , he has never married and has a lecherous side.
sentences.chinese: 他虽已中年，但尚末娶妻，特别好色。

sentences.english: Although they are plays on words, the scholars can choose one or two of them.
sentences.chinese: 虽为游戏笔墨，但治学者或当有一二可取者耳。

sentences.english: The hard fut battle for recognition has been won, but it is by no means over.
sentences.chinese: 这场艰苦的女性能力认可战虽已打赢，却远未终结。

sentences.english: Kneeling is not fall, but may be trampled.
sentences.chinese: 跪着虽不会跌倒，但可能被践踏。

sentences.english: Though badly damaged by fire, the bus tried to make for its garage.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车虽被大火严重烧坏，仍努力开回车库。

sentences.english: Concubinage is still the privilege of the rich class, but there still exist the phenomenon that the civilian concubinage.
sentences.chinese: 纳妾虽属于富贵阶层的特权，但平民纳妾也不在少数。

sentences.english: Although people going to follow, but also try to find a telephone.
sentences.chinese: 外出时虽有人跟随，但也要想办法找电话打。

sentences.english: The ship's orchestra's conductor stood to one side, looking peeved but apprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 舰队的管弦乐团指挥站在一边，面色虽愠怒但很知趣。
济慈所作之诗虽简洁却不失为壮丽。

sentences.english: It is also the real response of local architecture of Chu.
sentences.chinese: 虽浮想联翩，亦不失为楚乡土建筑实状的反映。

sentences.english: But thou wast ever bravely meek.
sentences.chinese: 但你虽一向温和却很勇敢。

sentences.english: Although China and Saudi is thousands of kilometers away, the people in both countries have intercourse since long ago.
sentences.chinese: 中国和沙特虽相距数千公里，但两国人民早有来往。

sentences.english: Memory is the hour of clothes, though no longer lares and useful.
sentences.chinese: 回忆是小时后的衣服，舍不得丢弃，虽已不再有用。

sentences.english: It was full of large fish, 153, but even with so many the net was not torn.
sentences.chinese: 鱼虽这样多，网却没有破。

definition: despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
that being the case/then/in that case
